title: This flex-ranked matchmaking is a joke. Please fix your game

embed.description: The easy way to save screenshots, GIFs, and websites. Make everyone happy by sharing smarter, faster, and with your point crystal clear.

replies.body:
Considering that most people are playing their placement matches, and MMRs are fluctuating, there's a solid chance matchmaking won't get it right every time. 

My first Flex Queue game involved 7 gold players. My 9th and 10th games involved 9 diamond players. Over time it'll hopefully become more accurate, only speaking from experience.

Even with a "Soft reset"
That doesn't mean reset everyone MMR to 0, so everyone can play with everyone.

Lets just make it so lvl 20's can play too, everyone gets to join in.

>Considering that most people are playing their placement matches

This is a pathetic excuse.

Bronze's can be in games with plats, Silvers can be in games with diamonds.

It's likely (but don't quote me on this because I'm really just guessing) that those who were marked as solo/duo in S6 have a hard mmr reset for flex queue and will go through placements for that queue, and those who were marked as dyna or 5s will have a hard (or maybe just harder) reset for solo/duo and will have to go through placements in that queue. 

It's also likely only for preseason, and shouldn't really change much (if you're Gold and lose to Diamonds you're going to lose near to no mmr, and if you won against Bronzes then you wouldn't really gain any) as far as next season is concerned.

That said, If I find any more info about why flex matchmaking is so wonky atm I'll update you.

Bro I have similar unfair games in flex Queue, but even so they can still be won. Just look at this one lmao.
